concise_definition: v. 调查, 研究, 查明

definitions.explanation_en: To examine or inquire into something systematically and in detail, especially to discover the truth, causes, or responsibilities behind an event or issue.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指系统而详细地审查或探究某事，尤其是为了发现事件或问题背后的真相、原因或责任。
definitions.example_en: Police are investigating the cause of the fire that destroyed the building.
definitions.example_cn: 警方正在调查导致这栋建筑被焚毁的火灾原因。

definitions.explanation_en: To conduct a formal or official inquiry, often by authorities or experts, to gather evidence and reach a conclusion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由权威机构或专家进行正式调查，以收集证据并得出结论。
definitions.example_en: The committee will investigate allegations of corruption within the department.
definitions.example_cn: 该委员会将对部门内部的腐败指控展开调查。

definitions.explanation_en: To explore or study a subject or phenomenon with the aim of gaining deeper understanding, often in scientific or academic contexts.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为获得更深入的理解而探索或研究某一主题或现象，常用于科学或学术语境中。
definitions.example_en: Scientists are investigating the effects of microplastics on marine life.
definitions.example_cn: 科学家正在研究微塑料对海洋生物的影响。

comparison.analysis: “Examine” (检查) 指对事物进行仔细查看或分析，但不一定涉及深入探究原因或责任，范围较窄，常用于日常或非正式场景。而 “investigate” 更强调系统性、目的性和权威性，通常用于复杂或严肃的问题。
“Inquire” (询问/打听) 通常指提出问题以获取信息，语气较温和，不一定伴随证据收集或正式程序。而 “investigate” 包含更主动、更全面的取证和分析过程，常带有官方或专业性质。
“Probe” (深入探究) 与 “investigate” 非常接近，常可互换，但 “probe” 更强调深入、尖锐甚至秘密的调查，常用于揭露隐藏问题或敏感事件，带有更强的紧迫感和攻击性。
